Author: Mare M
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
Review Body: I've been using two monitors for years. When I purchased a 27-inch all-in-one a few years ago, I replaced a desktop with two 24-inch monitors. I purchased another brand 27-inch monitor that started blacking out just after the return window closed. I put up with it for a couple of years and decided to replace it with a, hopefully, more dependable model.It took about 5 minutes, after unpacking, to have it up and running. Slip the riser into the stand, tighten the screw, slip the monitor on the riser, plug in the HDMI and power cables, and set it up in your display settings. That's all there is to it. Couldn't be easier. I'm not using the eye saver mode, I have an app I'm already using for that, so I can't comment on the monitor app. The curve isn't dramatic. It's just a slight curve and it actually does make a difference, compared to a flat screen. I can't really fully explain it, but it makes it easier to focus your eyes on the web page. You can pretty much view the entire page without moving your head, or even your eyes, much. The image quality is excellent, bringing even small details and print into full focus.Note: I paid an excellent price when I purchased this monitor on December 3rd. The price has raised three times since I made my purchase. If you aren't planning on purchasing this monitor as a Christmas gift, you may want to wait until after Christmas to see if the price drops back down.

Review Body: Well after receiving my monitor 3 days past when it was promised during my purchase readback - I finally get it and its defective (great, right?!)  The toggling feature on the back of screen for the menu/settings doesnt work when toggling up or to the right so any settings I can get to I can only toggle to the left vs right.  Contacted Samsung directly - very nice process for no fee - and checked to ensure it wasnt user error.  They send you a link to allow you to aim your phone at your screen so they can see what is occurring - after she put me on hold they determined its a defect.  The hiccup for me is that it could take a "long time" per the rep before they could fix and return.  It also meant that i had to print the label and bring it to the post office - with no printer however its useless since they have no other option.  Obviously, I went by way of returning it to Amazon with no label needed - yaay!  The other thing I found out is using my model and serial number she advised me there is only a 1 year warranty not 3 yr as it states in the description on Amazon.  I inquired about it and she wasnt sure how this could be - if anyone understands how that works feel free to comment as I'm unsure as well.  Now, I LOVE Samsung and never have any issues with their products but this one issue bugged due to the timing of delivery by Amazon then its defective and now the only option is returning it to Amazon and trying all over again - I wish there was a simpler way.

Author: Mr. J
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2023
Review Body: The Samsung CF390 Series 27-inch FHD Curved Desktop Monitor for Business has proven to be an excellent addition to my workspace. Its immersive curved design, coupled with FHD 1920x1080 resolution, provides a captivating viewing experience that truly enhances productivity and enjoyment.Setting up the monitor was a breeze, thanks to the HDMI and VGA connectivity options and its VESA mountable design. It seamlessly integrated with my existing setup, allowing me to start using it right away without any technical hassles.The curved display is the standout feature of this monitor. It adds depth and dimension to visuals, creating a more engaging and realistic feel when working or enjoying multimedia content. The wide 178-degree viewing angles ensure consistent image quality from various positions, making it ideal for collaborative projects or presentations.I appreciate Samsung's inclusion of a 3-year warranty and TAA compliance, offering peace of mind and assurance of the product's quality and longevity. The monitor's sleek black finish adds a touch of elegance to my workspace, contributing to a professional and modern aesthetic.While the overall performance is commendable, I would have liked to see some additional ergonomic features, such as height adjustability or swivel options, to cater to various user preferences and enhance comfort during extended use.In conclusion, the Samsung CF390 Series 27-inch FHD Curved Desktop Monitor is an excellent choice for both business and personal use. Its immersive curved display, user-friendly setup, and warranty coverage make it a reliable and worthwhile investment. With the addition of some ergonomic enhancements, this monitor could easily earn a solid 5-star rating. If you seek an engaging and visually appealing desktop monitor, the Samsung CF390 Series is definitely one to consider.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2023
Review Body: The good: curve is nice, screen appearance is good, but they make noise (with different colors/images for some reason) and seem extremely sensitive to static discharge.  I replaced two older ACER 27" monitors with these when one finally died.  All other components/cables stayed the same, now I have monitors that have a high-pitched squeal sometimes and often flicker off when I stand up, move around.  Not the end of the world, and the image quality is good, but certainly not a home run either.EDIT: The ESV sensitivity turned out to be some DP->HDMI adapters I had on the monitors.  Swapping those out for newer ones solved that 100%.  I still have a huge level of capacitor noise from them, though, which I cannot understand why nobody else is mentioning.  If I hadn't gotten 2 with identical behavior I'd think it was a parts problem, but seems like I should've returned these quickly and gone another route.EDIT2: Having owned these 2 monitors for over a year now, the noise issue has just been ongoing and it blows me away how bad it is/was.  Last night I was actually getting a headache from the nonstop high-pitched noise, so much so that I decided I was just going to trash these year-old monitors and replace them.  But, I spent about 20 minutes fiddling with every setting and FINALLY found a random combination of values that actually reduced the noise to barely perceptible.  While it's a relief to be able to be in front of these comfortably now, it still blows me away that ANY modern, brand-name monitor has any scenario where it's generating so much terrible electronic noise.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2022
Review Body: This is a gorgeous monitor at a very attractive price. I can't speak to its use as a gaming monitor, as I use it for general computing (email, web-browsing, docx and pdf file creation, YouTube and streaming video, etc.), but for my purposes it is wonderful. The curved screen is a real plus, especially at this large image size, and it's a breeze to set up on a Windows 10 computer.A word of advice: the base of this monitor is different from the one shown in the Amazon ad. As you can see in the accompanying photo, the base is round, rather than the winged version that Amazon displays in its ad. (There are other models in the CF390 series that have the winged base, but not this one.) I was actually happy about that mismatch, as the round base seems preferable to me -- it takes up less room on my desktop.Note also that the printed documentation that comes with this monitor is meager, at best. There is little there but some hard-to-interpret ideograms for setting it up (with accompanying text in English, French, Spanish, and Portuguese), and a brochure explaining the (to my mind, useless) "Eye-Saver Mode" in 34 different languages. Seriously!What's missing is any instruction on the use of the "joy-stick" control on the back of the monitor, which is an all-purpose control for setting brightness, contrast, display mode, on-off, etc. It's pretty intuitive, but still, there should be something. Fortunately, there is a downloadable PDF at the Samsung website that is more like a proper user's guide. But even that does not discuss the use of the joy-stick. What is it with the people who write documentation for tech products?But enough griping. This is a magnificent monitor at a very attractive price. I just love it.

Author: Winterbark
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2022
Review Body: ok, i already have another monitor dedicated to Gaming. this monitor will be specifically used for internet windows and some videos. my MAJOR complaint is how you MUST remove the back panel to remove the desk mount. that is NEVER noted or explained in the directions in any way, you have to google it.  aside from that i am pleased with the monitor so far. i STRONGLY advise you to cut the brightness down to 50%. that 100% is enough to be a flashlight  in your face in a dark room once you open google.  there are no intuitive controls, the power button is a directional pad/button. so that took a minute to figure out. i will likely be getting a second unit to accent the build and offer more screen space. TECHNICALLY this is a 24 inch resolution stretched to a 27 inch screen, so YOU WILL see some minor distortion and maybe some fuzzy print. you will have to alter that via the setting available in  the unit, or through the GPU software settings.i am usually pleased with Samsung products, so i am happy that this monitor keep the expectations.

Author: Gee
Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2022
Review Body: I got this monitor back in 2019 for $208, and it's served me extremely well for the past few years. I primarily used it to extend the display on my 2011 Toshiba laptop during that time. 1080p was perfect, because my laptop wasn't really capable of anything more than that. I did have a recurring issue with the display sometimes not turning on after my laptop wakes up from sleep. I would have to manually unplug the monitor, wait a few seconds, and plug it back in...that got kind of annoying, but it was still great besides that!Don't get this monitor expecting a great picture if you connect it to a Mac, or any newer computer for that matter. It's native resolution is 1080p, not 4k. As some other reviewers have mentioned, if you connect it to a newer machine, you'll really notice the lack of resolution in the text.
